Position Description : ThinkTek is seeking an Industrial Security Analyst with an active Top Secret security clearance. This analyst position supports risk-based industrial security oversight mission by providing impactful pre-Security Review research and analysis relevant to the National Industrial Security Program (NISP). Research sources vary, but are primarily limited to commercial and government databases, controlled unclassified information (CUI), and publically available information (PAI). Currently, due to COVID-19 mitigation efforts, a hybrid work arrangement of telework and on-site support temporarily exists. However, the applicant should be within daily commuting distance of the aforementioned office location. Security clearance qualifications must be verifiable through either the Defense Information System for Security - Joint Verification System (DISS-JVS) or “Scattered Castles.” Key Responsibilities include: Producing impactful research and analysis of potential risks to cleared defense contractors (CDC) and Department of Defense (DoD) programs. Identifying and reporting potential vulnerabilities associated with the CDC. Identifying and reporting possible OPSEC or other security issues associated with the CDC. Identifying and reporting possible violations of 32 Code of Federal Regulation (CFR) National Industrial Security Program Operating Manual (NISPOM) Part 117 requirements. Authoring professional work products and meeting established deadlines. Working in a collaborative on-site work environment at DCSA or independently through customer approved telework. Qualifications & Clearance Requirements: Bachelor's degree preferred but not required. Experience in writing analytic reports based on review and application of critical thinking skills towards complex hierarchal structures and relationships Basic understanding of international dynamics in relation to U.S. security concerns Experience with security-related data systems such as the National Industrial Security System (NISS), and the Defense Information System for Security - Joint Verification System (DISS-JVS), OR three (3) years' experience in intelligence or counterintelligence. Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills. Ability to understand and apply the principles of research to analyze, evaluate, and interpret raw data collected from multiple sources. Current Top-Secret (TS) security clearance verifiable through DISS-JVS, and prior to start date.
